content:
So, there doesn't appear to be any active maintainer on the nomicon (https://github.com/rust-lang/nomicon) at the moment (in fact many recent PRs have not been reviewed)
Most recently, Gankra and before that, Centril seemed to be taking care of it.
I don't know if the nomicon is under the control of the lang team or not (sorry if it's the wrong place to ask!), but we are checking the toolstate of this document, so it would be nice to have someone to take care of it explicitly.
I'm happy to help maintain if the members approve it
or if someone wants to do it, it'd be also great :)
I think the answer is that the lang team should take care of it, but -- much like the reference -- we haven't really managed to setup a sustainable way to do that
so does it make sense to have wg-nomicon or something else to promote things?
oh, I found a similar topic: https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/237824-t-lang.2Fwg-reference/topic/Nomicon.3F
I think at least it makes sense that we have the stream here so that we can ask the reviews like the reference
I think it makes sense for the nomicon and the reference to be under the same roof
@Yuki Okushi We would love to see ongoing contributions to it and tending of it. :)
If the problem becomes bandwidth to review PRs, that'll be a good problem to have. :)

Josh Triplett said:

I think it makes sense for the nomicon and the reference to be under the same roof

it means the nomicon team should be included to the reference one? or should they be under the lang team but separated?
Just saying that I think it makes sense for the teams to work together. :)
They're both language-level documentation.
ah got it!
can help maintaining it if needed as well :smile:
so, could I propose forming the team as a first step? I'd like to fix the toolstate of nomicon but it's blocked due to the absence of reviewers
cc @nikomatsakis and/or @Josh Triplett --^

any updates here? I'd like to submit a PR to the team repo to form the initial nomicon team if there's no objection (actually, we were blocked in https://github.com/rust-lang/nomicon/pull/233 for about two weeks)
cc @nikomatsakis and/or @Josh Triplett, sorry to ping again, but I'd like to hear your opinions as the team leads
Hmm
I'm sorry, it's kind of hard for me to dedicate much mental bandwidth to this right now :)
maybe open an issue on the lang-team repo, or a "MCP" proposal?
I do think creating a team makes sense in general tho

nikomatsakis said:

I'm sorry, it's kind of hard for me to dedicate much mental bandwidth to this right now :)

ahhh, don't worry, I may know what the cause is, sorry to bother...

nikomatsakis said:

maybe open an issue on the lang-team repo, or a "MCP" proposal?

sure! will do shortly
opened: https://github.com/rust-lang/lang-team/issues/47
we don't really need a team, even giving write-access to a bunch of people will be sufficient enough. Though a team will be easier for coordination
well, given there's the reference team already and they coordinate fine, I think it's reasonable here as well
at least, zulip stream or something is needed, I believe
@Yuki Okushi Does it make sense to have two separate groups, or might it make sense to have a lang-doc group that has permission to both the nomicon and the reference?
Even if some people more commonly commit to the nomicon and others more commonly commit to the reference, I don't think any harm would be done by giving both sets of people commit access to both.
@Josh Triplett I don't have a strong opinion/objection for it but I feel like they deal with a slightly different areas.

well, indeed it's annoying a bit to form a team each time we create a new docs
so I don't mind it's separated or not :)
That's kinda what I was thinking.

Hey @Josh Triplett, any updates on this, could we just go ahead, or is approval from the team is needed? #t-lang/doc is already created so we could finish this topic by setting up for the actual team and perms
I think a team and permissions are already set up for the reference, so it would just be a matter of giving that same team permission to the nomicon, and then adding people to that team.
That does need lang approval for the delegation, but you could file an issue on the rust-lang/team repository about it, and cc rust-lang/lang to confirm.
Someone can chime in and say "yes, please go ahead", and then infra can handle the permission change.
okay, I'll file it later, thanks!
opened: https://github.com/rust-lang/team/issues/443

@nikomatsakis Friendly-ping! I think this proposal is accepted as some lang members ack. The rest of the process is to merge the PR on the team repo (https://github.com/rust-lang/team/pull/445) and set up repository permission (I guess it's enough that the team has write access for the nomicon and reference), this can be done by someone from the core. Could you take care of it as a lang lead and core?
The toolstate is fine right now but it'd be great if we could finish things before breakage :) Thanks!
@Yuki Okushi thanks!
thanks Niko for reviewing/merging it <3
it'd be great if someone could set-up repository permission so that we can start working on it
@Yuki Okushi I can do that, yeah
@Yuki Okushi ok lang-docs should have write access to nomicon
and to the rust reference
Awesome, thanks for taking care of it!
